subject: Re: [junit] A simple design question about Hibernate testing
msgSnippet: ... I d even go further and recommend sharing read-only data, particularly if the data is somewhat expensive to set up and tear down. One thing to watch out
messageBody:
On 08/12/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 12/7/05, ara_vartanian <ara_vartanian@...> wrote:
> >
> > I understand that a good unit tester ought not have a shared test
> > fixture
>
>
> It's actually fine to share read-only data between methods since it doesn't
> make your test methods dependent on each other.

I'd even go further and recommend sharing read-only data, particularly
if the data is somewhat expensive to set up and tear down.

One thing to watch out for: if you are writing a new test that
requires slightly different data, consider adding new data rather than
changing what you've already got.
